Member Function Documentation

uint32 SMSStringUtility::printSMSString (  char *const   dest,
const char *const   src,
StringTable::languageCode  language,
UserConstants::EOLType  eol,
uint32  phoneWidth,
uint32  destLinePos = 0,
uint32  maxNbrLines = MAX_UINT32,
bool  newLineAfterString = true
)  [static]
 

Print one string (NULL-terminated) into another, formatted according to the given parameters.

This method might be used by the other formatting methods in this class as well as by other classes.

Parameters:
dest String where the result is written.
src String containing the information that should be written correctly formatted to dest.
language The language of the string text if error.
eol The type of end of line for the receivers telephone.
phoneWidth The number of characters of the receivers deisplay.
destLinePos The offet to the first line. Default value is 0.
maxNbrLines The maximum number of lines (if the result does not fit it is truncated). If less than one then the needed number of lines are used. Default value is MAX_UINT32.
newLineAfterString True if the string shouls end with eol, false otherwise. Dafault value is true.
Returns:
The number of characters written to the dest string dest.

uint32 SMSStringUtility::writeEol (  char *  dest,
uint32  pos,
UserConstants::EOLType  eol,
uint32  charsLeftOnLine
)  [static]
 

Write end of line to a string.

The format and the number of characters required depends on the phonetype (the EOLType parameter given to this method).

Parameters:
dest The destination databuffer.
pos The position of the first character to write to dest (e.g the first character is written to dest[pos]).
eol What end of line type the receivers telephone have.
charsLeftOnLine The number of characters left on the current line. Needed if the phone does not recognize any new line character and must be padded with spaces.
Returns:
The number of characters written to dest.
